dev.kkorolyov.simplelogs

Class Logger

  • Object
    • Logger

  • public class Logger
extends Object
    Simple logging interface for multiple levels.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Logger.Level
      Specifies the level of granularity for message logging.

    • Method Detail

      • applyProps

        public static boolean applyProps(Path logProps)
        Applies logging properties defined in a file. Properties should be defined in the format:

        LOGGER=LEVEL, WRITERS...

        • LOGGER - name of a logger
        • LEVEL - the logger's logging level
        • WRITERS - list of comma-delimited files or streams the logger logs to

        Valid output streams:

        • OUT - System.out
        • ERR - System.err
        Parameters:
        logProps - path to logging properties file
        Returns:
        true if property application successful

      • applyProps

        public static boolean applyProps(Path logProps,
                                 Path root)
        Applies logging properties defined in a file. Properties should be defined in the format:

        LOGGER=LEVEL, WRITERS...

        • LOGGER - name of a logger
        • LEVEL - the logger's logging level
        • WRITERS - list of comma-delimited files or streams the logger logs to

        Valid output streams:

        • OUT - System.out
        • ERR - System.err
        Parameters:
        logProps - path to logging properties file
        root - path prefixing all log files defined in the logging properties file
        Returns:
        true if property application successful

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String name)
        Retrieves the logger of the specified name, if it exists. If such a logger does not exist, a new logger is created using the specified name, a default logging level of INFO, and a default writer to System.err.
        Parameters:
        name - logger name
        Returns:
        appropriate logger

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(String name,
                               Logger.Level level,
                               PrintWriter... writers)
        Retrieves the logger of the specified name, if it exists, and sets its level and writers to the specified parameters. If such a logger does not exist, a new logger is created according to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        name - logger name
        level - logging level
        writers - log writers
        Returns:
        appropriate logger

      • exception

        public void exception(Exception e)
        Logs an exception at the SEVERE level.
        Parameters:
        e - exception to log

      • exception

        public void exception(Exception e,
                      Logger.Level level)
        Logs an exception at a specified logging level.
        Parameters:
        e - exception to log
        level - level to log at

      • log

        public void log(LazyMessage message,
                Logger.Level level)
        Attempts to log a lazy message. The message creation function is executed only if the resultant message would be logged.
        Parameters:
        message - message to log
        level - message's level of granularity
        See Also:
        log(String, Level)

      • log

        public void log(String message,
                Logger.Level level)
        Attempts to log a message at a specific level of granularity. If this logger is disabled, the specified granularity level is finer than this logger's current granularity level, or this logger does not have a valid writer, the message is not logged.
        Parameters:
        message - message to log
        level - message's level of granularity

      • isLoggable

        public boolean isLoggable(Logger.Level level)
        Checks if a message of a specified level would be logged by this logger.
        Parameters:
        level - logging level to test
        Returns:
        true if a message of the specified level would be logged by this logger

      • getLevel

        public Logger.Level getLevel()
        Returns:
        logging level

      • setLevel

        public void setLevel(Logger.Level newLevel)
        Sets the level of this logger.
        Parameters:
        newLevel - new logging level

      • addWriter

        public void addWriter(PrintWriter toAdd)
        Parameters:
        toAdd - writer to add

      • removeWriter

        public void removeWriter(PrintWriter toRemove)
        Parameters:
        toRemove - writer to remove

      • getWriters

        public PrintWriter[] getWriters()
        Returns:
        all writers

      • setWriters

        public void setWriters(PrintWriter... newWriters)
        Sets the writers used by this logger. All subsequent messages logged by this logger will be written by these writers.
        Parameters:
        newWriters - new writers; if null, will simply clear all writers

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if logger enabled

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - if true, enables logger; else, disables logger
